results.title: Jerusalem: within these walls
results.creator_credit: Miriam Birch, National Geographic Society and WQED
results.brief_description: Narrated by Christopher Plummer, this program offers a kaleidoscopic view and history of the city which is an important centre for three of the world’s great religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam. The old city is divided into four quartes - Christian, Muslim, Jewish and Armenian, where about 26,000 people live. The video profiles residents of old Jerusalem including a Jewish family of Yemeni jewellers; a Belgian refugee from Nazism; a Muslim artisan and television performer, Halil; Father Timothy, private secretary to the Greek Orthodox patriarch and finally, an Armenian Christian, survivor of Turkish oppression, who now works as a photographer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Miriam Birch, National Geographic Society and WQED

results.title: Jenin Jenin
results.brief_description: Dedicated to the Executive Producer of ‘Jenin’ Iyad Samoudi who was murdered at Alyamoun at the end of the filming by Israeli soldiers on 23/6/2000. Mohammad Bakri A film of despair, human tragedy, hatred, cynicism and last but not least, of hope. This is the story of the 8 day bombardment by the Israeli Defence Forces of the autonomous Palestinian refugee camp in Jenin (Palestine) during April 2000. The camp itself was just about razed to the ground by fighter planes, tanks, missiles, and bull-dozers and all that remained at the time of filming were piles of rubble, half-demolished houses and thousands of homeless Palestinians. Many civilians including children, women and the elderly lost their lives. The older population in Jenin feel lost and defeated, betrayed by the Arab nations and the West, but at the same time they are looking to the younger generation to maintain the resistance and keep fighting for the future of all Palestinians and a free Palestinian State. Through interviews and personal stories from many of the refugees, from the young to the old, Palestinian actor/director Mohammad Bakri presents an intimate portrayal of the extent to which the prolonged oppression and terror has affected the Jenin refugees. Contains graphic archival footage (some in b&w) of the invasion and the aftermath of disaster and destruction. The film was banned in Israel for its propensity to engage in propaganda. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Jean's fugue
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the activities at a Summer Music School at Cambridge. The intensive work and casual fun make the fortnight at Cambridge University benefit both the individual musician and the music world.

results.title: Jealousy = Pebhoot
results.creator_credit: Todor Dinov and State Distribution Centre
results.brief_description: Animation using musical notation whereby the stave represents the ground and groups of notes have the appearance of horses and riders, after the style of the traditional western. Includes a sequence when a treble clef is seized for use as a lassoo.

results.title: Jealousy
results.brief_description: An absorbing program, hosted by psychologists Peter Quarry, in which people talk about their jealousy - how they felt, what they did and why. A private investigator, police and psychologists discuss how jealousy can lead to violence and present strategies for coping with it.

results.title: Jazz mania
results.creator_credit: Chris Hubbard and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: This production takes a look at the impact of Jazz on people and society when it was firstly introduced in the 1920’s. Incorporating archival footage with dramatised scenes resembling newsreels of the time, the film documents the shock and consternation registered by polite society.

results.title: Jazz in the concert hall. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein explains and illustrates the nature of jazz and its fusion with serious concert music since the 1920’s. Includes three major works performed by the New York Philharmonic Orchestra and soloists to illustrate this fusion: Gunther Schuller’s “Journey into jazz” featuring jazz musicians Don Ellis (Itrumpet), Eric Dolphy (alto sax), Benny Golsen (tenor sax), Richard Davis (bass) and Joseph Cocuzzo (drums); Aaron Copland’s “Concerto for piano and orchestra”; Larry Austin’s “Improvisations for orchestra and jazz soloists”.

results.title: Japanese: language and people. [kit]
results.creator_credit: Brian Moeran, Richard Smith, Terry A. Doyle, Trevor Hughes Parry, BBC and Intervoice Incorporated
results.brief_description: This excellent kit comprising of five audio cassettes, a teacher manual and student reference book is designed to accompany the ‘Japanese: language and people’ videos. The tapes contain dialogues, exercises and practice material which is closely integrated to the course book. The teacher’s manual contains lesson suggestions in order to provide a strong framework for learning the language, while the course book provides an accessible introduction to the written language along with insights into contemporary Japanese society.

results.title: Japanese women [Short version]
results.creator_credit: Kalle Lasn, Don Hopkins, George Johnson, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film that examines the changing roles and problems of women in Japan at a time in Japanese and Western societies when the nature of the family is undergoing rapid change and women’s role in society is being redefined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kalle Lasn, Don Hopkins, George Johnson, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
